definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
karoshi (loanword from Japanese), death from overwork

overweight from overwork (the supposition that white collar workers become fat as a consequence of factors associated with being under pressure at work, including irregular diet, lack of exercise and inadequate rest)

sentences.english: Over-fatigue is a big killer to many medium-aged people.
sentences.chinese: 过劳是很多中年人的杀手。
第二，劳动者“过劳”的事实。

sentences.english: Don't overstrain when you feel weak.
sentences.chinese: 不要过劳，当你觉得疲累的时候。

sentences.english: Police officials believe the man died from heart failure caused by extreme tiredness.
sentences.chinese: 警察相信他乃死于过劳导致的心脏衰竭。

sentences.english: A study finds the land of the free has become the land of the overworked and stressed.
sentences.chinese: 一项调查显示自由之地已经变成过劳和压力之地。

definition: karoshi (loanword from Japanese), death from overwork
sudden death (in medicine, sporting competitions etc)

overweight from overwork (the supposition that white collar workers become fat as a consequence of factors associated with being under pressure at work, including irregular diet, lack of exercise and inadequate rest)
deficiency of kidney essence due to sexual excess (TCM)
to stay up late or all night
to strike a balance between work and rest (idiom)
